Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2009 02:48PM - edited Feb 25, 2009 02:48PM by 41jq Jane: Thanks for the info. on the itchy spot on my breast.  I will go to a dermatologist and get it checked.   You said the IBC doesn't come and go and my spot comes and goes, so it must be something else.  I'm just scared right now about my BSGI test tomorrow.  I have so many things going through my head.  I wish I just new what the outcome was, so I could make a plan and move forward.  This waiting and wondering is awful.  I have small children, so I can't really talk about it.  I don't want them to know anything until I find out.  I'm praying nothing will show up in the test.  I haven't seen very many people talk about the BSGI test, but I should know something right after the test.  Well a biopsy would be the next step.  I'm sorry to hear you also had painful mammograms.   I believe its all about the tech.  I had one digital mammogram and it was better, but I've had 3 regular mammograms and 1 was fine.  They should never allow the tech to use the foot pedal for the final press.  They should have to turn the knob for the final compression.  12 more hours and I should have some answers. ..  Thanks for your help!  Jodi
Posts.Title: Itchy skin of one breast?? 41jq Adi22

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2009 02:07PM 41jq wrote: Thanks for your reply's.  I took my BSGI Test today.  Everything is ok!  I'm so lucky and thankful.  The doctor at the Breast Clinic said no signs of Cancer.  The calcification's were normal.  My regular doctor will also look at the results, but I don't think he will want further testing for now. I know I'm in the high risk category and may develop it at some point.  I promised them I would go to my yearly mammogram every Nov.  No one could explain the itchy spot on the top of my Breast. I'm going to go to a dermatologist and get him to check me all over, for skin cancer.  Skin cancer also runs in my family.  Dad, Uncle, Grandfather.  My husband just had a piece cut off his face.  I was a sun worshiper back in the day, but now I stay covered up or lots of sunscreen.    I really appreciate your reply's and information!   I hope the lady who first replied about her itchy breast is ok.  The whole waiting game was just awful for me and I really appreciate the people who set up this website .  It helped me so much!  I will stay in touch. Thanks again for all your help and support.  Jodi I plan to stay a member of this website and check it periodically for new updates and information.  I will stay in touch.
Posts.Title: Itchy skin of one breast?? 41jq Adi22

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2009 05:52AM 41jq wrote: Thanks for your reply.  I promise I will have annual checks from now on!  I just hope I haven't waited too long already.  One of the reason's I waited so long was I had a horrible experience with my Mammogram 10 years ago.  The first mammogram 10 years ago was fine.  It hurt, but not bad at all.  The tech was great.  The second one I had 10 years ago, since the first one showed something suspicious was horrible.  I almost fainted 2 times.  I had to sit down.  The lady was using a foot pedal and not rolling the plates down with the knob.  She couldn't feel how hard she was going with the foot pedal.  I wanted to strangle the lady.  I have small breasts.  Anyway,  The same thing happened to me with my last two mammograms recently.  The first one went well, no major pain.  The lady pushed the foot pedal some, but then rolled the plates down at the end with the hand knob.  Then since the mammogram showed my dense tissue and calcification's I had to do another one.  The second one a different lady did it and she used the foot pedal and I screamed and she was like, oh did that hurt.  I was furious.  This time I was to mad to feel faint from pain.  Anyway, I hate to rant about my mammograms, but they haven't been pleasant.  I will now ask them to roll the plates down and please not use the foot pedal for the final step!  I'm not sure if anyone else has experience this , but it was not fun.  I will not let this problem interfere with my annual mammogram anymore.  I will be strong and deal with it.  Sorry, for the long story, but I needed to vent.    The itching is only my left breast and I guess around a 12 o'clock position, but a little more towards my chest bone.  My breast are small, so it's more at the top of my breast.  The weird thing is it was there a year ago and stayed for about 4-6 months and then went away for about 4 months and now is back.  And I can't see anything on the skin.  I do not itch the area, but it drives me crazy.  I'm going to tell the doctor's at the breast clinic tomorrow, and see what they say, but I'm also going to go to a Dermatologist and see what they say.   I didn't mention it to the doctors when I had a mammogram, since it went away.    Now it's back since I've been waiting to do the BSGI Test.  It may have something to do with my nerves.  Thanks for your help.  Please let me know what your doctor say's.   Thanks, Jodi
Posts.Title: Itchy skin of one breast?? 41jq Adi22

Posts.Content: 41jq wrote: I've had two Mammograms in the past 2 months and now I'm scheduled for a BSGI test tomorrow.  I have very dense breasts and calcification's.  About a year ago I showed my Gynecologist a itchy spot on my breast.  He said it didn't look like anything.  I put different creme's on it and it finally went away.   Now it's back.  I've been researching Breast Cancer since I'm about to have the BSGI test.(New Test)  I've read a few articles where breast cancer can go to the skin and cause a itchy area.  Now I'm really freaking out!  Has anyone had a itchy spot on their breast.  It doesn't really look like anything is there.  No dry flaky skin.  I have lots of freckles, so it's hard to see anything that's causing it.  It maybe my nerves going crazy!   My dad had skin cancer on his nose.  My mom had Breast Cancer at 50.  I'm 41.  I had a mammogram at 31 since my mom had breast cancer.  The mammogram at 31 showed my calcification's, but no further testing at the time was done.  I didn't go back for 10 years.  I feel very upset at myself for not getting checked every year.  I had my children at 34 and 38, so I've been very busy with them.  I know it's no excuse.  I  can't turn back time, so if anyone has any info. about itchy skin with no dryness, please let me know.  Thanks for listening.  Any help would be appreciated!  Jodi Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Itchy skin of one breast?? 41jq Adi22

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2009 05:33PM 41jq wrote: I have dense breast, calcification's, and my mother had breast cancer, so  my doctor suggested I do a BSGI Test.  It's been out about 2 years and only 35 places in the US do the test.  The test is compared to the MRI Test, but the BSGI doesn't show the false positives like a MRI.  I'm having the test in the morning, so I will let you know what happens.  I haven't found any bad info about the test, except for the exposure to radiation.  They have some info. about it on this website under molecular testing.  Most women on this website have not had the test.  I've been scanning the discussion boards for about a week and I've only read a few discussions about it.  I wonder if more women will have this test in the future instead of the MRI??  Jodi
Posts.Title: Gentle Reminder for the Dense Breasts Ladies Aug242007 ravdeb

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2009 06:56PM 41jq wrote: Thank you so much for the info.  I feel much better!  It's nice talking to someone else who is going through the same thing.  My doctor didn't mention a biopsy, but I guess that's my next step.  I'm also glad the procedures were not too painful.   I don't like the idea of watching the black dots on the screen, but I will take my anxiety medicine before I do the test.  I'm praying your test result is good.  Did they see a lump on your mammogram?  Or were they just testing the califications?  I think I may have micro-calcifications, since I have many in both breasts.  Thanks again for all your help!  I really appreciate it!  I will stay in touch.  Jodi
Posts.Title: BSGI Testing and Calcifications 41jq pcharlene

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2009 04:19PM 41jq wrote: Thanks again for your reply!  I'm so lucky to have found you!  It's very hard to wait and wonder what the outcome will be.  I've been having pains in my breasts the past few day's and I'm not sure if its the stress of all this , or what's causing it.  I've never really had pains before.  Except soreness.  I also have a spot on one breast, which is on the skin on the outside.  About a year ago it appeared.  It itches.  It's not a sore, and I don't think it's a mole.  It's just a small spot that itches.  I showed it to my gyno. and he said to put neosporin on it.  It went away for about 3 months and then reappeared last month.  I'm going to show it to the lady when I do my BSGI Wed.  I guess I need to go to a Dermatologist to make sure it's not some type of skin Cancer.  My dad had skin cancer on his nose, but it was removed.  My husband had it on his face and he had it removed.  I'm praying for your results to be negative! Thanks again for all your help and info.  Jodi(Waiting and wondering)
Posts.Title: BSGI Testing and Calcifications 41jq pcharlene

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 10:55AM 41jq wrote: Here's a link to the info. on this website: http://www.breastcancer.org/symptoms/testing/types/mbi.jsp It is also called molecular imaging.  BSGI is Breast Specific Gamma Imaging.  I researched it all over the Internet:  Mayo Clinic was one site.   This test has only been around about 2-3 years.  Only 35 places in the US can do the test.  I think 4 are in the Houston, Tx. area.  I'm lucky and live 25 miles from Houston.  Nancy the lady who was talking above was in VA.  Where are you? I went to a breast Clinic to have the test done.  My Gyno/Ob.  actually new nothing about the test.  He was hesitant.  Most people would do a MRI, or I guess the biopsy you were talking about in this situation, or sit and wait 6 months.  I didn't want to wait any longer!  The waiting and wondering drove me crazy.  I needed to know.  My insurance has a very high deductible(2500.00), so a MRI would have cost me too much.  BSGI only cost me 186.00.   I was hesitant about the BSGI test, since they inject you with a radioactive dye.  Look above and Nancy explained the test well.  After meeting her i decided to have the test.  When I was researching it on the Internet I didn't find anything neg. about it.   My micro-calcification's were spread out all over my breasts.  I don't think they gathered in one area.  I remember the Doctor at the Breast Clinic saying they couldn't do a biopsy on me, since none of the calcification's were clustered in one area.    They wanted to make sure nothing was in the dense breast tissue, since it's hard to see cancer in the dense tissue.  I'm not a doctor and I think I'm telling all of this info. correctly.  When I would go in the doctor's office I was pretty nervous, so I may be missing something.  Fulloflife:  If I were you I would ask your doctor about the test.  If they don't know anything about it, then I would research the Internet and try and find a Breast Clinic in your area who does the BSGI test.  The test is not painful!  If the test does show a suspicious area, then I believe you will need a biopsy after the test.  Nancy above did the biopsy shortly after the BSGI.  Good luck!   I hate to hear someone else going through what I did with the Mammograms.  I don't think my painful mammograms is in this post, but I have another post where I explained my terrible experience.  I think it's the tech. who makes it a terrible experience.  I've had 4 mammograms and only 1 was digital and 2 were fine and 2 were horrible.  I firmly believe its the technicians fault. When you scream and they say: Oh did that hurt!  They have no soul!  I've been through pain in my life and I'm not a baby or one who wines for no reason.  From now on I will have a conversation with all the tech. before the mammogram.  I had two tech. who were very caring people.   Anyway, enough about that.  Sorry, I get a little carried away when I start thinking about it.  Please keep getting tested don't wait.   Good luck!  Let me know if you can find a Breast Clinic in your area who does the BSGI.  Jodi
Posts.Title: BSGI Testing and Calcifications 41jq pcharlene

Posts.Content: 41jq wrote: Hi: I was wondering if anyone could help me??  Here's my story.  I will try and make it as short as possible.  I had a mammogram and they said I had very dense breast and calcification's.  I needed another mammogram and ultrasound.  I went to The Rose Clinic in Houston, Tx.  They did a second mammogram and no Ultrasound then told me they wanted me to do a BSGI test.  (They inject a radioactive dye in your vein and do a scan of your breast.  The test has been around about 2 years and only 35 places throughout the US give the test.)  It sounded scary to me, so I called  my Gyno and asked him about it.  He didn't know anything about it.  He referred me to the Breast Diagnostic Clinic in Clear Lake, Tx.  I'm scheduled to do the BSGI test next Wed. Feb. 25 at the Rose.  Right now I'm trying to get my Mammograms from The Rose Clinic to take to the Diagnostic Clinic to let a Dr. Drayer look at them and get a second opinion.  Can anyone give me some info. about either clinic?? or about the BSGI Test??  The Rose Clinic Dr. mentioned a Biopsy , but basically said it would be hard to do it because I have so many calcification's he wouldn't know where to do the biopsy.  At least I think that's what he said.  I was in shock when they came in to talk to me and was telling me I needed more testing.   Any help would be greatly appreciated!!  My mom had Breast Cancer at 50 and is now 67 and doing great.  I'm 41.  Thanks for your help!  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: BSGI Testing and Calcifications 41jq pcharlene

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2009 11:12PM 41jq wrote: Thanks for your reply.  I'm sorry to hear your results were positive.  I'm glad you only need a lumpectomy and radiation.  I know it's scary, but you will get through this.  I'm glad your family is close by.  You are in my prayers.  I will stay in touch.  My BSGI test is in 12 hours!  I'm hoping if I have cancer I can get away with a lumpectomy.  I don't think I'm mentally prepared for a Mastectomy.   I will let you know my results.  Jodi
Posts.Title: BSGI Testing and Calcifications 41jq pcharlene

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2009 09:41PM 41jq wrote: Nancy: I'm so lucky!  My test showed no signs of cancer.  The micro calcification's were ok.  I did not get to watch the dots appearing on the screen.  I just talked to the tech. about our children.  It was scary, but basically no pain.  (Just like you said).  I promised the doctor I would go to my annual Mammogram every Nov.  They were pretty hard on me for skipping the past 10 years, because of my mom's breast cancer.   I"m 41 years old with two small children.  I know they need me and I need to stay on top of this disease, so I can watch them grow up.  I'm going to stay on this board, so it will remind me how important it is to be checked annually.  I"m alway's taking care of other people and putting my health to the side.  This scare has showed me I'm just as important as my family and I need to make my health a priority.  NO more excuses! I want to stay in touch with you!  You are in my prayer's.  Take care.  Your friend Jodi.
Posts.Title: BSGI Testing and Calcifications 41jq pcharlene
